amendment.description: To establish a spending-neutral reserve fund relating to requiring the Federal Government to allow states to opt out of Common Core without penalty.

vote.text: Amendment SA 515 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 54 - 46. Record Vote Number: 105.

action.text: Amendment SA 515 proposed by Senator Vitter. (consideration: CR S1857-1858; text: CR S1857) To establish a spending-neutral reserve fund relating to requiring the Federal Government to allow states to opt out of Common Core without penalty.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 515 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 54 - 46. Record Vote Number: 105.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 515 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 54 - 46. Record Vote Number: 105.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 515 proposed by Senator Vitter.
